title: In New York, is this the end of Trump Tower?
description: Located in the heart of Manhattan, the 58-story building embodies the success and power of the former president of the United States. Prosecuted for financial fraud, the billionaire could lose his jewel.

title: Belgian justice minister resigns following fatal Brussels attack
description: Vincent Van Quickenborne resigned on Friday due to a 'monumental error' involving the extradition request from Tunisia for an Islamic extremist responsible for the recent killing of two Swedes and injuring another.

title: Rugby World Cup: New Zealand dominates Argentina to secure spot in final
description: New Zealand bulldozed through Argentina 44-6 on Friday to reach the Rugby World Cup final for a record fifth time. The All Blacks will bid for a record fourth title against defending champion South Africa or England, who play their semifinal on Saturday.

title: Arab world protests against Israel's actions against Gaza
description: Demonstrators throughout Arab nations voiced their dissent against Israel's bombardment of Gaza, with a clear call to end diplomatic normalization resonating in Egypt, Bahrain, and Tunisia.

title: Hamas releases two American hostages
description: The Israeli government on Friday confirmed that Judith Tai Raanan and her daughter Natalie Shoshana Raanan were in Israeli custody. Hamas attributed their release to the diplomatic efforts of the Qatari government, marking a significant milestone as the first hostage release in this conflict.

title: House Republicans drop Jim Jordan as speaker nominee
description: The hard-line conservative and Trump supporter was dropped by Republicans after losing a third vote to become speaker of the US House of Representatives.

title: On Israeli television, the manufacture of heroes and the justification of revenge on Gaza
description: Since the Hamas attack on October 7, the Jewish state's TV channels have been broadcasting military news, patriotic reports and messages of support. Hardly any images of Palestinian territory appear on screen.

title: Republican-led US House rejects Jim Jordan's third bid for speaker
description: Lawmakers voted to reject the hard-line conservative and Donald Trump supporter again on Friday, compounding the chaos that has left the government without a functioning legislative branch for weeks.

title: French troops to leave Niger by year's end, says general
description: The commander of France's forces in the Sahel said that 1,500 French soldiers would leave the West African country by December 31.

title: Slovakia: Robert Fico to appoint pro-Russian ministers
description: The future prime minister wants to entrust the foreign affairs ministry to an ally lacking experience. Centrist President Zuzana Caputova said she will veto the appointment of the prospective environment minister, who believes that CO2 is a 'globalist scam to impose communism.'

title: Rugby World Cup 2023: Argentina's unexpected semi-final against New Zealand
description: After a poor start to the World Cup, Argentina have gradually righted their ship and on Friday will be aiming to repeat their 2020 and 2022 exploits – the only two occasions when they have beaten the All Blacks.

title: Macron's majority delivers tax gift to international sports federations
description: On October 18, MPs from France's presidential majority tabled an amendment to the 2024 budget bill. It exempts FIFA in particular, which has an annex in Paris.

title: Inside the Azerbaijan-controlled Nakhchivan exclave, closed to Western media for 30 years
description: Shortly before clearing Nagorno-Karabakh of its Armenian residents, authoritarian President Ilham Aliyev quietly restored his sovereignty over an exclave populated exclusively by Azerbaijanis.

title: Scotland's First Minister Humza Yousaf shares the distressing experiences of his in-laws in Gaza
description: Married to an elected representative of Palestinian origin, the Scottish leader has called for a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas.

title: Dominique Bernard's funeral in Arras: Refusing to give in to anger and hatred
description: The funeral of the teacher stabbed to death by a former student outside his school during a jihadist attack was held on Thursday.

title: French immigration bill: Why the government's measure to revoke residence permits is legally questionable
description: The French government promises to take action against foreigners who are legal residents but opposed to the 'values of the Republic'. Legal experts highlight the risk of arbitrary decisions.

title: Pompidou staff renews strike
description: The center's staff are calling for their jobs to be maintained during the five years of closure, from 2025 to 2030, and for a single location to be found for the redeployment of employees.

title: French government growing impatient over fake bomb alerts, threatens prison terms
description: False alarms forced the evacuation of 15 airports as well as shutting the doors to the Palace of Versailles repeatedly since last Saturday. No bombs have been found as of now.

title: Wars in Ukraine and Gaza: Biden tries to convince America of the need for US leadership
description: The day after his trip to Tel Aviv, the American president addressed US citizens, with the aim of getting Congress to vote in favor of financial aid for Ukraine and Israel.

title: The number of homeless children in France is rising, and the French government is called upon to act
description: Associations, metropolitan mayors and MPS, including members of the majority, are calling on the government to increase the number of emergency shelters, which has dropped in recent months.

title: Israel-Hamas war: One map to visualize Gaza's hardest-hit areas since start of offensive
description: Satellite images recovered by Le Monde show the areas targeted by the Israel Defense Forces. Strikes have hit across the enclave, day and night.

title: In Italy, the Meloni government's honeymoon with the financial markets is over
description: A surprise tax on banks, a larger-than-expected deficit, concerns about corporate governance rules... The Italian government has investors worried.

title: Mahmoud Abbas in Le Monde, from a man in the shadows to the disputed president of the Palestinian Authority
description: The leader, who is also known as Abu Mazen, was pivotal to the Oslo Accords aimed at resolving the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. He has always opposed Hamas but never succeeded in weakening it.

title: Biden addresses the US to say support for Israel and Ukraine is 'vital for America's national security'
description: He said he would send an urgent funding request to Congress, which is expected to be roughly $100 billion over the next year. The proposal, which will be unveiled on Friday, includes money for Ukraine, Israel, Taiwan, humanitarian aid and border management.

title: Niger military rulers say ousted President Bazoum 'tried to escape'
description: Since he was toppled by the military on July 26, Bazoum has refused to resign. Until now, he has been held at his residence in the heart of the presidential palace along with his wife and son.
